instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00480: What is 820-00480? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.message:
question mark folder , no water damage, i was try good know ssd but the same.. and do not show on disk utility.
before it was work but if i was shout it out with the charger connected and turn it on it wasn't work! other way it was work ok.
but now it wont work anymore.

threads.message: Be aware, I think there is a difference between 2016/17 SSD type.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message: Then should be some problem on the board, or SSD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message:
First you should check if the machine is affected by [URL]https://support.apple.com/13-inch-macbook-pro-solid-state-drive-service[/URL]

About compatibility between 2016/2017:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://beetstech.com/blog/apple-proprietary-ssd-ultimate-guide-to-specs-and-upgrades[/URL]
[QUOTE]After extensive testing with every Gen. 5A drive we could get our hands on, it appears that 128GB SSDs with part numbers beginning with 656-0074 and 256GB SSDs with part numbers beginning with 656-0076 are only compatible with the model <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> laptops from the Mid 2017 release.[/QUOTE]
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> being the 2017 model, it shouldn't be a problem.
Note that the <SIGNAL>SSD_BOOT_L</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_L</SIGNAL> circuit is different between <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (2016) and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (2017). Only the schematics for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is available, in this one <CHIP>U8640</CHIP>/<RESISTOR>R8645</RESISTOR> are populated while <RESISTOR>R8641</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R8642</RESISTOR> are not. On the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> it's the opposite.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message: thanks for that, i do have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> scheme and boardview, im also put good ssd from the same board number (2017) but it not recognized it to.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message:
First check L8600/02.
Next check input and output levels for <CHIP>U8640</CHIP>.
Also need to know <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> levels.
<SIGNAL>SSD_EN</SIGNAL> goes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message:
L8600:
1.<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> -0V
2.<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD_SNS</SIGNAL>-3.3V

L8602:
1.<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> 0V
2. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD</SIGNAL> - 13V


<CHIP>U8640</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5G</SIGNAL> -1.8v stable
all the rest 1.8v-0v pulsing at the beginning and then 0v.

<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SSD_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3V
